settings.content:
“How to choose a pillow?” is often a question neglected by many people.

Mattresses get a lot of attention these days, and rightly so. After all, whether you get a good night’s rest will depend tremendously on the type of foundation where we spend many hours of our lives sleeping.

However, people often forget another component that is also extremely important: your pillow.

Using an uncomfortable pillow can result in you waking up with pain in your neck and shoulders or other areas of your body. It can also affect your ability to fall and stay asleep.

The perfect pillow will depend on your body and sleep habits. Remember, your pillow should be comfortable and support your head, neck, and shoulders.

So, how do you choose a perfect pillow?

settings.title: Tips for Choosing the Perfect Pillow
settings.content: Selecting a pillow does come down to individual preferences and your sleeping position, but here are some tips to consider before you make your purchase:

settings.content_1:
Feather pillows (down pillows) might be an option if you prefer light and soft pillows that come from duck or goose fibres. However, these pillows can be quite expensive and are not hypoallergenic.

Microfiber and cotton are perfect for those who need a hypoallergenic pillow that is also firm.

Meanwhile, memory foam is for those who want a pillow that adapts to their specific shape. Memory foam pillows are also ideal for those with head, neck, or shoulder pain since they contour to specific areas and offer support.
settings.content_2:
Depending on how much you move your pillow during the night, weight might be an important consideration for you.

Cotton and down pillows are lighter than memory foam and latex options.

Most people will be happy with standard pillow sizes, which are also easier to find pillowcases for. If you decide to go with a smaller or larger pillow, make sure the case you select is the right size and that you aren’t stuffing your pillow inside the case or letting it lay in a sea of fabric.
settings.content_3:
Select a pillow with a breathable and washable pillow case or cover.

A breathable pillowcase will ensure that heat flows from your head to the pillow and out into the atmosphere. With this, you don’t overheat during the night.

settings.title: Pillow for Different Types of Sleepers
settings.content:
Do sleep positions influence your choice of a perfect pillow? The short answer is YES.

However, the answer is more complicated to explain since we all change position during the night.

No one is a side or back sleeper all the time. That being said, there are probably some positions that you favour a bit more than others.

Here are some basic rules that will help you in determining which pillow matches your sleeping style:

settings.content_1:
Stomach Sleepers like soft pillows and, in some cases, no pillow at all.

Instead of having a pillow underneath their heads, front sleepers might opt for a pillow under their stomach and pelvis to attain alignment.

Back Sleepers usually favour a thinner, flatter pillow for keeping the neck aligned with the spine. They may also favour a softer pillow.

However, if you are already experiencing neck pain, a supportive pillow would also be an ideal choice. In this case, try to find a pillow that still feels soft, but also provides sufficient support.

Side Sleepers, on the contrary, would prefer a thicker, firmer pillow.

According to SleepFoundation.org, a good rule of thumb is to find a pillow that is as thick as the distance between your shoulder and the opposite ear.

settings.title: Conclusion
settings.content:
Choosing the right mattress means a lot for a night of better sleep, but the pillow also plays an equally important role when improving your sleep quality.

It is also critical you take your sleep habits into account when choosing a pillow. Besides, the right pillow stuffing and cover also matter a lot.
